7 #include <sys/types.h>
8 #include <unistd.h>
9 #include <glib-2.0/glib.h>
10 #include <gstreamer-1.0/gst/gst.h>
11 #include <stdio.h>
12 #include <string.h>
13 #include "../include/trap/deviceError.h"

19 #define COLOR_RED "\x1b[31m"
20 #define COLOR_GREEN "\x1b[32m"
21 #define COLOR_YELLOW "\x1b[33m"
22 #define COLOR_BLUE "\x1b[34m"
23 #define COLOR_MAGENTA "\x1b[35m"
24 #define COLOR_CYAN "\x1b[36m"
25 #define COLOR_RESET "\x1b[0m"
26 
27 /* For a radix of 8 we need at most 3 output bytes for 1 input
28  * byte. Additionally we might need up to 2 output bytes for the
29  * readix prefix and 1 byte for the trailing NULL.
30  */
31 #define FORMAT_UNSIGNED_BUFSIZE ((GLIB_SIZEOF_LONG * 3) + 3)
32 
33  static void
34 format_unsigned (gchar *buf,
35  gulong num,
36  guint radix)
37 {
38  gulong tmp;
39  gchar c;
40  gint i, n;
41 
42  /* we may not call _any_ GLib functions here (or macros like g_return_if_fail()) */
43 
44  if (radix != 8 && radix != 10 && radix != 16)
45  {
46  *buf = '\000';
47  return;
48  }
49 
50  if (!num)
51  {
52  *buf++ = '0';
53  *buf = '\000';
54  return;
55  }
56  if (radix == 16)
57  {
58  *buf++ = '0';
59  *buf++ = 'x';
60  }
61  else if (radix == 8)
62  {
63  *buf++ = '0';
64  }
65 
66  n = 0;
67  tmp = num;
68  while (tmp)
69  {
70  tmp /= radix;
71  n++;
72  }
73 
74  i = n;
75 
76  /* Again we can't use g_assert; actually this check should _never_ fail. */
77  if (n > FORMAT_UNSIGNED_BUFSIZE - 3)
78  {
79  *buf = '\000';
80  return;
81  }
82 
83  while (num)
84  {
85  i--;
86  c = (num % radix);
87  if (c < 10)
88  buf[i] = c + '0';
89  else
90  buf[i] = c + 'a' - 10;
91  num /= radix;
92  }
93 
94  buf[n] = '\000';
95 }
96 
97 /* string size big enough to hold level prefix */
98 #define STRING_BUFFER_SIZE (FORMAT_UNSIGNED_BUFSIZE + 32)
99 
100 #define ALERT_LEVELS (G_LOG_LEVEL_ERROR | G_LOG_LEVEL_CRITICAL | G_LOG_LEVEL_WARNING)
101 
102 /* these are emitted by the default log handler */
103 #define DEFAULT_LEVELS (G_LOG_LEVEL_ERROR | G_LOG_LEVEL_CRITICAL | G_LOG_LEVEL_WARNING | G_LOG_LEVEL_MESSAGE)
104 /* these are filtered by G_MESSAGES_DEBUG by the default log handler */
105 #define INFO_LEVELS (G_LOG_LEVEL_INFO | G_LOG_LEVEL_DEBUG)
106 
107  static FILE *
108 mklevel_prefix (gchar level_prefix[STRING_BUFFER_SIZE],
109  GLogLevelFlags log_level)
110 {
111  gboolean to_stdout = TRUE;
112 
113  /* we may not call _any_ GLib functions here */
114 
115  switch (log_level & G_LOG_LEVEL_MASK)
116  {
117  case G_LOG_LEVEL_ERROR:
118  strcpy (level_prefix,COLOR_RED"ERROR"COLOR_RESET);
119  to_stdout = FALSE;
120  break;
121  case G_LOG_LEVEL_CRITICAL:
122  strcpy (level_prefix, COLOR_RED"CRITICAL"COLOR_RESET);
123  to_stdout = FALSE;
124  break;
125  case G_LOG_LEVEL_WARNING:
126  strcpy (level_prefix,COLOR_RED"WARNING"COLOR_RESET);
127  to_stdout = FALSE;
128  break;
129  case G_LOG_LEVEL_MESSAGE:
130  strcpy (level_prefix, COLOR_YELLOW"Message"COLOR_RESET);
131  to_stdout = FALSE;
132  break;
133  case G_LOG_LEVEL_INFO:
134  strcpy (level_prefix,COLOR_GREEN"INFO"COLOR_RESET);
135  break;
136  case G_LOG_LEVEL_DEBUG:
137  strcpy (level_prefix,COLOR_BLUE"DEBUG"COLOR_RESET);
138  break;
139  default:
140  if (log_level)
141  {
142  strcpy (level_prefix, "LOG-");
143  format_unsigned (level_prefix + 4, log_level & G_LOG_LEVEL_MASK, 16);
144  }
145  else
146  strcpy (level_prefix, "LOG");
147  break;
148  }
149  if (log_level & G_LOG_FLAG_RECURSION)
150  strcat (level_prefix, " (recursed)");
151  if (log_level & ALERT_LEVELS)
152  strcat (level_prefix, " **");
153 
154  return to_stdout ? stdout : stderr;
155 
156 }
157 
158  static void
159 write_string (FILE *stream,
160  const gchar *string)
161 {
162  fputs (string, stream);
163 }
164 
165  void
166 log_handler (const gchar *log_domain,
167  GLogLevelFlags log_level,
168  const gchar *message,
169  gpointer unused_data)
170 {
171  gchar level_prefix[STRING_BUFFER_SIZE], *string;
172  GString *gstring;
173  FILE *stream;
174  const gchar *domains;
175 
176 
177  if ((log_level & DEFAULT_LEVELS) || (log_level >> G_LOG_LEVEL_USER_SHIFT))
178  goto emit;
179 
180  domains = g_getenv ("G_MESSAGES_DEBUG");
181  if (((log_level & INFO_LEVELS) == 0) ||
182  domains == NULL ||
183  (strcmp (domains, "all") != 0 && (!log_domain || !strstr (domains, log_domain))))
184  return;
185 
186 emit:
187  stream = mklevel_prefix (level_prefix, log_level);
188 
189  gstring = g_string_new (NULL);
190 
191  GDateTime *log_time = g_date_time_new_now_local();
192  gchar *log_time_str = g_date_time_format(log_time, "%F %T");
193  g_string_append_printf ( gstring , "[%s]", log_time_str);
194  g_free(log_time_str);
195  g_date_time_unref(log_time);
196 
197  if (!log_domain)
198  g_string_append (gstring, "** ");
199 
200  if (( (log_level & G_LOG_LEVEL_MASK) ))
201  {
202  const gchar *prg_name = g_get_prgname ();
203 
204  if (!prg_name)
205  g_string_append_printf (gstring, "(process:%lu):\t", (gulong)getpid ());
206  else
207  g_string_append_printf (gstring, "(%s:%lu):\t", prg_name, (gulong)getpid ());
208  }
209 
210  if (log_domain)
211  {
212  g_string_append (gstring, log_domain);
213  g_string_append_c (gstring, '-');
214  }
215  g_string_append (gstring, level_prefix);
216 
217  g_string_append (gstring, ":");
218  if (!message)
219  g_string_append (gstring, "(NULL) message");
220  else
221  g_string_append (gstring, message);
222 
223  g_string_append (gstring, "\n");
224 
225  string = g_string_free (gstring, FALSE);
226 
227  write_string (stream, string);
228  g_free (string);
229 }

237 gboolean gst_element_link_log( GstElement *element1 , GstElement *element2 ){
238 
239  /* link element1 to element2 payloader */
240  if ( !gst_element_link(element1,element2 )){
241  send_deviceError_trap();
242  g_critical("failed to link %s to %s", GST_ELEMENT_NAME(element1), GST_ELEMENT_NAME(element2));
243  return FALSE;
244  }
245 
246  return TRUE;
247 
248 }
255 GstElement *gst_element_factory_make_log( const gchar *element, const gchar *name ){
256 
257  /* make an elment */
258  GstElement *return_elt = gst_element_factory_make( element , name );
259 
260  /* check if everything went ok, if not, display an error message */
261  if ( !return_elt ){
262  if ( element && name )
263  g_critical("cannot create element %s named %s", element , name);
264  else
265  g_critical("cannot create element, NULL values given");
266  send_deviceError_trap( );
267  return NULL;
268  }
269 
270  return return_elt;
271 
272 }
273 
274 void init_logger(){
275  g_log_set_default_handler (log_handler , NULL );
276 }
